key_points: Governor Greg Abbott announces actions to tackle the rise in COVID-19 cases in Texas.
Texas to utilize staffing agencies for bringing medical personnel from out-of-state to assist in COVID-19 operations.
Abbott has asked the Texas Hospital Association to voluntarily postpone elective medical procedures to increase hospital capacity.
Texas Division of Emergency Management (TDEM) and the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS) directed to open additional COVID-19 antibody infusion centers.
New infusion centers aim to treat COVID-19 patients without hospitalization using therapeutic drugs.
An existing infusion center in Lubbock to expand; five new centers to open, starting with San Antonio.
Measures similar to those deployed in early 2021 are being reintroduced.
Increased vaccination availability across the state is being encouraged.
Texans can find a vaccine provider or schedule mobile vaccine clinics through provided resources.
Governor Abbott stresses the safety and effectiveness of the COVID-19 vaccine and urges Texans to get vaccinated.
